content:
It's great that you're thinking of applying the improvisation techniques you learned in the workshop to your audition preparation. Improvisation can be a fantastic tool to help you prepare for an audition, and it's even more beneficial that you recently attended a workshop and are still familiar with the techniques.

Since you attended the workshop from April 15th to 17th, the techniques are still fresh in your mind, and you can easily apply them to your audition preparation. Remember to focus on the exercises and techniques that resonated with you the most, and don't be afraid to experiment and try new things.

As you prepare for your audition, keep in mind that improvisation is not just about being funny or spontaneous; it's also about being present, listening, and responding truthfully. These skills can help you bring a sense of authenticity and confidence to your audition, which can make a big difference in your performance.

Remember to also practice your lines, research the character and script, and prepare your materials as usual. The improvisation techniques can be used to supplement your traditional audition preparation, not replace it.

If you have any specific questions or concerns about how to apply the improvisation techniques to your audition preparation, feel free to ask. I'm here to help!
